DOC.HEADLINE: METROPOLITAN DIGEST / LOS ANGELES COUNTY NEWS IN BRIEF : LOS ANGELES ; ARAB GROUP ' S DIRECTOR QUITS TO RETURN TO MIDEAST
DOC.TEXT: The Southern California regional director of the American-Arab Anti-Discrimination Committee , Nazih Bayda , has resigned for personal reasons , and plans to resume his career as a petroleum engineer by taking a job in the Persian_Gulf sheikdom of Abu Dhabi , it was announced Thursday . Bayda , 35 , played a key role in protesting interviews of prominent Arab Americans by the FBI at the beginning of the Gulf War in 1991.A previous regional director of the Anti-Discrimination Committee , Alex Odeh , was murdered 1985 . Bayda said that damage at his San Fernando Valley home from the Jan . 17 earthquake had led to his family ' s decision to leave Los Angeles . His performance at the Anti-Discrimination Committee , where he had been regional director for six years , won praise from Don Boustany , the group ' s Los Angeles-area president .
